segments.text: Billy , you don ’ t look too well . Maybe you should take the day off school .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: But Mom ! Today we ’ re playing football ! I love football !
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You ’ Ve god a fever and playing football isn ’ t a good idea for a boy with a fever . What ’ s that on your arm ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I don ’ t know . It was there when I woke up this morning .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It ’ s a rash . I ’ d better take you to see the doctor . How did you get that bruise on your leg ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I bashed it against the chair in my room .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Here . Put this wet towel on your face to keep your temperature down . I ’ ll take you to the doctor ’ s after breakfast .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: If I ’ m better this afternoon , can I go to school ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: If you are better , but I doubt you will be .
segments.speaker: S1
